segment.source: Tabs and pivots are enable users to navigate between frequently accessed content.
segment.target: Tabs and pivots are enable users to navigate between frequently accessed content.

segment.source: Tabs and pivots
segment.target: Tabs and pivots

segment.source: Tabs and pivots
segment.target: Tabs and pivots

segment.source: Tabs and pivots are used for navigating frequently accessed, distinct content categories.
segment.target: Tabs and pivots are used for navigating frequently accessed, distinct content categories.

segment.source: The tab/pivot pattern is made of two or more content panes that have corresponding category headers.
segment.target: The tab/pivot pattern is made of two or more content panes that have corresponding category headers.

segment.source: The headers persist on-screen and have a selection state that's clearly shown, so users are always aware of which category they're in.
segment.target: The headers persist on-screen and have a selection state that's clearly shown, so users are always aware of which category they're in.

segment.source: An examples of tabs
segment.target: An examples of tabs

segment.source: Tabs and pivots are effectively the same pattern, and both are built using the Pivot control.
segment.target: Tabs and pivots are effectively the same pattern, and both are built using the Pivot control.

segment.source: The basic functionality of the Pivot control is described later in this article.
segment.target: The basic functionality of the Pivot control is described later in this article.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: Pivot class
segment.target: Pivot class

segment.source: The tab/pivot pattern
segment.target: The tab/pivot pattern

segment.source: When building an app with the tab/pivot pattern, there are a few key design variables to consider based on the pattern's configurable feature set.
segment.target: When building an app with the tab/pivot pattern, there are a few key design variables to consider based on the pattern's configurable feature set.

segment.source: Header placement.
segment.target: Header placement.

segment.source: Headers can be placed at the top or the bottom of the screen.
segment.target: Headers can be placed at the top or the bottom of the screen.

segment.source: NotePlacing headers at the bottom of the screen requires re-templating the Pivot control.
segment.target: NotePlacing headers at the bottom of the screen requires re-templating the Pivot control.

segment.source: Header labels.
segment.target: Header labels.

segment.source: Headers can have an icon with text, text only, or icon only.
segment.target: Headers can have an icon with text, text only, or icon only.

segment.source: Header alignment.
segment.target: Header alignment.

segment.source: Headers can be left-justified or centered.
segment.target: Headers can be left-justified or centered.

segment.source: Top-level or sub-level navigation.
segment.target: Top-level or sub-level navigation.

segment.source: Tabs/pivots can be used for either level of navigation, and can be stacked in a top-level/sub-level pattern.
segment.target: Tabs/pivots can be used for either level of navigation, and can be stacked in a top-level/sub-level pattern.

segment.source: When there are two levels of tabs/pivots, the top-level and sub-level headers should have enough visual differentiation so that users can clearly separate the two.
segment.target: When there are two levels of tabs/pivots, the top-level and sub-level headers should have enough visual differentiation so that users can clearly separate the two.

segment.source: Touch gesture support.
segment.target: Touch gesture support.

segment.source: For devices that support touch gestures, you can use one of two interaction sets to navigate between content categories:
segment.target: For devices that support touch gestures, you can use one of two interaction sets to navigate between content categories:

segment.source: Tap on a tab/pivot header to navigate to that category, or swipe on the content area to navigate to the adjacent category.
segment.target: Tap on a tab/pivot header to navigate to that category, or swipe on the content area to navigate to the adjacent category.

segment.source: Tap on a tab/pivot header to navigate to that category (no swipe).
segment.target: Tap on a tab/pivot header to navigate to that category (no swipe).

segment.source: Pattern configurations
segment.target: Pattern configurations

segment.source: The optimal arrangement of the tab/pivot pattern depends on the interaction scenario and the device(s) on which your app will appear.
segment.target: The optimal arrangement of the tab/pivot pattern depends on the interaction scenario and the device(s) on which your app will appear.

segment.source: This table outlines some of the top scenarios and pattern configurations.
segment.target: This table outlines some of the top scenarios and pattern configurations.

segment.source: Interaction scenario
segment.target: Interaction scenario

segment.source: Recommended configuration
segment.target: Recommended configuration

segment.source: Moving laterally between 2 to 5 top-level list or grid view content categories on a phone or phablet
segment.target: Moving laterally between 2 to 5 top-level list or grid view content categories on a phone or phablet

segment.source: Tab/pivots: Placed at the top of the screen, centered
segment.target: Tab/pivots: Placed at the top of the screen, centered

segment.source: Header labels: Icons + text
segment.target: Header labels: Icons + text

segment.source: Swipe on content area: Enabled
segment.target: Swipe on content area: Enabled

segment.source: Moving between a range of content categories on a phone or phablet in which swiping on a content area isn't practical for navigation
segment.target: Moving between a range of content categories on a phone or phablet in which swiping on a content area isn't practical for navigation

segment.source: Tab/pivots: Placed at the bottom of the screen, centered
segment.target: Tab/pivots: Placed at the bottom of the screen, centered

segment.source: Header labels: Icons + text
segment.target: Header labels: Icons + text

segment.source: Swipe on content area: Disabled
segment.target: Swipe on content area: Disabled

segment.source: Top-level navigation with a mouse and keyboard
segment.target: Top-level navigation with a mouse and keyboard

segment.source: Tab/pivots: Placed at the top of the screen, left-aligned
segment.target: Tab/pivots: Placed at the top of the screen, left-aligned

segment.source: or
segment.target: or

segment.source: Header labels: Text-only
segment.target: Header labels: Text-only

segment.source: Page-level navigation on a touch device
segment.target: Page-level navigation on a touch device

segment.source: Swipe on content area: Disabled
segment.target: Swipe on content area: Disabled

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: This design of a food truck app shows what placing tab/pivot headers on the top or bottom can look like.
segment.target: This design of a food truck app shows what placing tab/pivot headers on the top or bottom can look like.

segment.source: On mobile devices, placing them at the bottom works well for reachability.
segment.target: On mobile devices, placing them at the bottom works well for reachability.

segment.source: An example of tabs on a mobile device
segment.target: An example of tabs on a mobile device

segment.source: The food truck app design on laptop/desktop features text-only headers.
segment.target: The food truck app design on laptop/desktop features text-only headers.

segment.source: Using icons with text for headers helps with touch targeting, but for mouse and keyboard, text-only headers work well.
segment.target: Using icons with text for headers helps with touch targeting, but for mouse and keyboard, text-only headers work well.

segment.source: Example of tabs on desktop
segment.target: Example of tabs on desktop

segment.source: Create a pivot control
segment.target: Create a pivot control

segment.source: The tab/pivot navigation pattern is built using the Pivot control.
segment.target: The tab/pivot navigation pattern is built using the Pivot control.

segment.source: The control comes with the basic functionality described in this section.
segment.target: The control comes with the basic functionality described in this section.

segment.source: This XAML creates a basic pivot control with 3 sections of content.
segment.target: This XAML creates a basic pivot control with 3 sections of content.

segment.source: Pivot items
segment.target: Pivot items

segment.source: Pivot is an ItemsControl, so it can contain a collection of items of any type.
segment.target: Pivot is an ItemsControl, so it can contain a collection of items of any type.

segment.source: Any item you add to the Pivot that is not explicitly a PivotItem is implicitly wrapped in a PivotItem.
segment.target: Any item you add to the Pivot that is not explicitly a PivotItem is implicitly wrapped in a PivotItem.

segment.source: Because a Pivot is often used to navigate between pages of content, it's common to populate the Items collection directly with XAML UI elements.
segment.target: Because a Pivot is often used to navigate between pages of content, it's common to populate the Items collection directly with XAML UI elements.

segment.source: Or, you can set the ItemsSource property to a data source.
segment.target: Or, you can set the ItemsSource property to a data source.

segment.source: Items bound in the ItemsSource can be of any type, but if they aren't explicitly PivotItems, you must define an ItemTemplate and HeaderTemplate to specify how the items are displayed.
segment.target: Items bound in the ItemsSource can be of any type, but if they aren't explicitly PivotItems, you must define an ItemTemplate and HeaderTemplate to specify how the items are displayed.

segment.source: You can use the SelectedItem property to get or set the Pivot's active item.
segment.target: You can use the SelectedItem property to get or set the Pivot's active item.

segment.source: Use the SelectedIndex property to get or set the index of the active item.
segment.target: Use the SelectedIndex property to get or set the index of the active item.

segment.source: Pivot headers
segment.target: Pivot headers

segment.source: You can use the LeftHeader and RightHeader properties to add other controls to the Pivot header.
segment.target: You can use the LeftHeader and RightHeader properties to add other controls to the Pivot header.

segment.source: Pivot interaction
segment.target: Pivot interaction

segment.source: The control features these touch gesture interactions:
segment.target: The control features these touch gesture interactions:

segment.source: Tapping on a header navigates to that header's section content.
segment.target: Tapping on a header navigates to that header's section content.

segment.source: Swiping left or right on a header navigates to the adjacent header/section.
segment.target: Swiping left or right on a header navigates to the adjacent header/section.

segment.source: Swiping left or right on section content navigates to the adjacent header/section.
segment.target: Swiping left or right on section content navigates to the adjacent header/section.

segment.source: The control comes in two modes:
segment.target: The control comes in two modes:

segment.source: Stationary
segment.target: Stationary

segment.source: Pivots are stationary when all pivot headers fit within the allowed space.
segment.target: Pivots are stationary when all pivot headers fit within the allowed space.

segment.source: Tapping on a pivot label navigates to the corresponding page, though the pivot itself will not move.
segment.target: Tapping on a pivot label navigates to the corresponding page, though the pivot itself will not move.

segment.source: The active pivot is highlighted.
segment.target: The active pivot is highlighted.

segment.source: Carousel
segment.target: Carousel

segment.source: Pivots carousel when all pivot headers don't fit within the allowed space.
segment.target: Pivots carousel when all pivot headers don't fit within the allowed space.

segment.source: Tapping a pivot label navigates to the corresponding page, and the active pivot label will carousel into the first position.
segment.target: Tapping a pivot label navigates to the corresponding page, and the active pivot label will carousel into the first position.

segment.source: The control has built-in breakpoint functionality, which is based on the number of headers and the string length of the labels.
segment.target: The control has built-in breakpoint functionality, which is based on the number of headers and the string length of the labels.

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: Base the alignment of tab/pivot headers on screen size.
segment.target: Base the alignment of tab/pivot headers on screen size.

segment.source: For screen widths below 720 epx, center-aligning usually works better, while left-aligning for screen widths above 720 epx is recommended in most cases.
segment.target: For screen widths below 720 epx, center-aligning usually works better, while left-aligning for screen widths above 720 epx is recommended in most cases.

segment.source: When scaling a window, once the number of tabs/pivot headers exceeds available real estate, start pushing headers into the overflow area.
segment.target: When scaling a window, once the number of tabs/pivot headers exceeds available real estate, start pushing headers into the overflow area.

segment.source: Tabs/pivots can be used in either screen orientation, but be sure to maintain the same total number of headers (visible and hidden) in both landscape and portrait orientations.
segment.target: Tabs/pivots can be used in either screen orientation, but be sure to maintain the same total number of headers (visible and hidden) in both landscape and portrait orientations.

segment.source: Avoid using more than 5 headers when using carousel (round-trip) mode, as having more than 5 can cause the user to lose orientation.
segment.target: Avoid using more than 5 headers when using carousel (round-trip) mode, as having more than 5 can cause the user to lose orientation.

segment.source: On mobile devices, placing tabs/pivots at the bottom works well for reachability, if swiping is used in another part of the UI, and to avoid top-heavy UI.
segment.target: On mobile devices, placing tabs/pivots at the bottom works well for reachability, if swiping is used in another part of the UI, and to avoid top-heavy UI.

segment.source: When the on-screen keyboard is deployed, headers can move off-screen to preserve space.
segment.target: When the on-screen keyboard is deployed, headers can move off-screen to preserve space.

segment.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
segment.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
segment.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
